intro: Trichopteryx densispica, commonly known as the dense-hairy rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of thick, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. Trichopteryx densispica is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Its adaptations make it well-suited for harsh, high-altitude climates.
